programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry is accompanied by two beautiful women to the auction, while newcomers Rene and Casey purchase a statue that could be worth thousands of dollars. Elsewhere, a professional wrestler appears at an appraisal.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Two rare and huge GI Joe playsets are deployed to the shop on the outskirts of Las Vegas.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A letter said to be signed by Napoleon makes Rick stand to attention. Other items under consideration include a surreal figure by Mexican artist Pedro Friedeberg, a 1960s Monkees talking puppet and original Dick & Jane illustrations.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les struggles to forgive Seth for trying to sell his business and decides to lock himself in the office. Meanwhile, a fight breaks out on the shop floor.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les faces a dilemma over the authenticity of a rare guitar and, with no expert on hand for advice, he is forced to go with his gut instinct.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Wade restores a toy train, but has to overcome various obstacles to keep the project on track, and a 1948 popcorn machine is spruced up.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Wade and the team gamble on returning a Prohibition-era slot machine to its former glory, and restore a 1930s cola cooler.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: A brutal attack that led to the murder of a woman near Anchorage, Alaska in 2000 - and how it took nine years for police to make a breakthrough in their investigation.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Good, the Bad and the Hungry
programme.desc: A locker belonging to a deceased tycoon goes up for auction, and all the bidders are determined to get their hands on its contents.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Burelson, where they set out to find items of value among huge truckloads of strange oddities.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley reacts to some bad manners in the shop queue, a kooky cowboy arrives at the counter and Rich makes an error that could cost him his job.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Golds are forced to take action when they witness a hustler scamming their customers in the car park. Plus, Seth and Ashley finally come to blows.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: A priceless relic of a statue of Christ unearthed on a shipwreck in Madagascar launches dive expert Barry Clifford and historian Scott Wolter on a worldwide investigation to find out if there is a link between two of history's most legendary sects - 17th-century pirates and the medieval Knights Templar.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: The team from UFO Magazine investigates what appear to be underwater landing strips and other strange evidence in the wake of UFO sightings in Florida.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: The alleged existence of underground extraterrestrial lairs, concentrating on a cave in Ecuador said to hold alien knowledge, and a hidden city in Turkey.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: The team tries to open an antique safe, but cracking the combination proves difficult, and a 1950s sweet machine is in need of restoration.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick Wade buys a 1950s cola cooler and plans to convert it into a dual climate hot dog cooler grill.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1969 Triumph Motorcycle gets Rick's engine roaring, but it remains to be seen whether he will make an offer the buyer cannot refuse.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A set of 1814 naval history books from John Adams' personal library sails into the shop.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend a locker auction at El Monte, California, where Jarrod and Brandi find their sense of charity and Barry unearths a bag that has him hitting the slopes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Compton, Mike buys something that Herb does not want to be anywhere near. Jarrod ends up with a new nickname while Barry and his old pal Kenny reunite.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Puffy in the Sky with Diamonds
programme.desc: Victor plans to get the better of the competition with some dirty tricks, while one of the teams buys a locker that could prove highly profitable.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: The Surgeon, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: A locker auction in Texas is in the path of a tornado, so the bidders try to complete their purchases before the storm hits.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four competitors look to secure a place in the final where they will be tasked with forging intricate Renaissance side-arm, the Katzbalger.

programme.title: Pirate Treasure of the Knights Templar
programme.desc: Scott Wolter follows the trail of the legendary Knights Templar to Portugal, where he learns some stunning new information that breaks the investigation wide open. Meanwhile, in Madagascar, Barry Clifford switches the team's focus to a wreck he believes is Captain Kidd's warship - and makes a groundbreaking discovery.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: To enter space, humans require a space suit. Are the aliens that are said to have visited Earth any different, or are they more akin to artificial drones?.

programme.title: Alien Files: Unsealed
programme.desc: In the spring of 1952, reports of UFO sightings rose significantly. Former US Air Officials attempt to shed light on the possible causes.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Reported sightings of angels, from ancient texts and biblical stories to more modern accounts, questioning whether they are the product of mankind's imagination - or really exist.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Kane Hodder, an actor who played Jason Voorhees in four of the Friday the 13th films, comes to American Jewelry to have a gold pendant featuring his trademark hockey goalie mask.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les and Ashley must properly determine the value of a shoddy bike. Meanwhile, Seth enters into a conflict with a New Jersey man, and a customer desires a TV.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive purchase in the history of the series at an auction in Orange.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey and Rene buy a small, mysterious unit, and discover it contains a Wizard of Oz chess set.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Early Western film star Harry Carey's collection of nearly 200 celebrity autographs arrives at the shop.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Rick gets a taste of British sweets when a Smarties dispenser is brought into the shop.

programme.title: Paranormal: Caught On Camera
programme.sub-title: The World's Most Haunted School and More
programme.desc: The World's Most Haunted School and More.

programme.title: Paranatural
programme.desc: Investigating freak cases of mass animal deaths and trying to discover why bee and bat populations are dramatically shrinking.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend a locker auction at El Monte, California, where Jarrod and Brandi find their sense of charity and Barry unearths a bag that has him hitting the slopes.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Compton, Mike buys something that Herb does not want to be anywhere near. Jarrod ends up with a new nickname while Barry and his old pal Kenny reunite.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry unleashes a batch of fiendishly puzzling questions to test the general knowledge - or ignorance - of Jo Brand, Liza Tarbuck, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies, who reveal what they know about topics including jelly, jam and juice.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Kerry Godliman, Nish Kumar and Rachel Parris. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts the quiz that tests the most obscure parts of contestants' general knowledge, awarding points for interesting answers as well as correct ones. Regular panellist Alan Davies is joined by Bill Bailey, Jimmy Carr and Only Connect host Victoria Coren Mitchell to answer fiendish questions on the topic of jargon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry unleashes a batch of fiendishly puzzling questions to test the general knowledge - or ignorance - of Jo Brand, Liza Tarbuck, Sue Perkins and regular panellist Alan Davies, who reveal what they know about topics including jelly, jam and juice.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon, Clive Myrie, Sara Pascoe and Rick Edwards test their general knowledge skills in more trivia-based games, with the winner announced on Friday.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Kerry Godliman, Nish Kumar and Rachel Parris. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim Warwood and Adam Gendle travel around the country to complete a variety of outlandish stunts, beginning with an attempt to bounce a man across a lake and into a target.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: James is called to a drunk driver who, in his inebriated state, has crashed his car into a parked vehicle at high speed, but the story takes a twist when his girlfriend arrives.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank discover a fleet of amazing concept cars, some so unique they do not know how to price them.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: In California, Brandon and Lori are given a surprise in one of their storage unit lots.

programme.title: Storage Hunters
programme.desc: Brandon and Lori discover a dead cow in one of their storage unit lots.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank come across a huge 200,000-square-foot factory-turned-private collection by Woody, its dumpster diving owner.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank make a gamble by buying an expensive samurai outfit, and unearth a collection of rare motorcycles.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Major body work is needed when the suspension and engine don't fit the Haunted Rod. Steve flips a 1920 Old Wayne Gas Pump to offset extra labour costs.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May compete in a 1950s-style race from London to Edinburgh. On the footplate of the A1 Tornado steam train, Jeremy has to feed the boiler with a constant supply of coal, while Richard braves the saddle of a Vincent Black Shadow motorbike and James drives an old Jaguar XK120 as the trio discover what Top Gear might have been like 60 years ago. Michael Schumacher drives the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Steve and Tim head up the night shift as they deal with an array of inebriated locals in Burton. Documentary series following the work of the Staffordshire Police force.

programme.title: Sin City Motors
programme.desc: Steve faces his toughest challenge yet when he must design a tour bus that represents WelderUp while meeting the high standards of his business partners.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Richard Hammond, Jeremy Clarkson and James May try to find the perfect car for 17-year-olds, dealing with insurance companies, accident repairs and a muddy music festival car park in the process. Richard also visits Abu Dhabi to test the Lamborghini Murcielago SV and stages a race between the 1000hp Bugatti Veyron and the McLaren F1. Actor, writer and comedian Stephen Fry is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters find three small cars at an affordable price - a task that involves pestering bankers, harnessing large dogs and almost getting arrested. James May meets American rally driver Ken Block, and Jeremy Clarkson tests out the Mercedes SL Black. Comedian Michael McIntyre is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Josh Widdicombe, Susan Calman and Rich Hall join regular panellist Alan Davies and host Sandi Toksvig for an extended episode on the theme of 'Origins and Openings'. During the course of the show, the panellists find out an assortment of facts, including what Mr First thought of Mr Second. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window, as the fiendishly difficult questions lead to points being awarded for the answers its questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Angela Scanlon, Clive Myrie, Sara Pascoe and Rick Edwards continue to test their general knowledge skills in a variety of entertaining trivia-based games.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Sports commentator Clare Balding, Radio 1 DJ Nick Grimshaw and comedians Rhod Gilbert and Rob Delaney join forces with team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the panel show in which participants attempt to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: TV presenter Richard Hammond, tennis coach Judy Murray and comedians Sean Lock and Trevor Noah join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show in which participants attempt to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rhod Gilbert, Jon Richardson and Kerry Godliman
programme.desc: Rhod Gilbert plays host for another dose of stand-up from the Hammersmith Apollo in London, warming up the audience before introducing routines by 8 Out of 10 Cats panellist Jon Richardson and actress and comedienne Kerry Godliman.

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Beach balls, water and sand contribute to a seaside feel to this episode, a jolly tone that is interrupted when Greg Davies deals with the questionable actions of one contestant.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts another round of the peculiar panel quiz and asks a range of unusual questions about journeys, finding out how much Rob Brydon, Phill Jupitus, Cal Wilson and regular panellist Alan Davies know about the subject.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Katy Brand, Sue Perkins and David Mitchell join regular panellist Alan Davies to answer Stephen Fry's obscure questions about people whose names begin with 'J'.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Factors influencing America's decision to support Britain during the Second World War, and how Hitler's declaration of war on the US convinced Congress to take more decisive action. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Slow Train Through Africa with Griff Rhys Jones
programme.desc: The comedian attempts to zigzag his way 1,200 miles through Kenya and Tanzania, beginning this leg of his journey on a vintage steam locomotive designed in Glasgow. On a cattle farm established by an aristocrat a century ago, he dons a pair of overalls and joins workers as they bathe more than 2,000 animals to ward off parasites and biting flies. Later, in the vast Tsavo East National Park, he bottle-feeds orphaned elephant calves, before visiting a Maasai village - where he quickly regrets a faux pas during a meat feast.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The spacecraft designed for the first manned mission to Mars, planned to launch by 2035, which requires the most powerful rocket ever built and a specially designed crew module.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: The documentary exploring historical mysteries returns, beginning with Jamie Theakston looking at the lost city of Petra in Jordan. The presenter questions whether any treasures still lie beneath the site in hidden tombs, and enlists the help of local historians.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The spacecraft designed for the first manned mission to Mars, planned to launch by 2035, which requires the most powerful rocket ever built and a specially designed crew module.

programme.title: Walking Through History
programme.desc: It was 30 years after the Romans invaded Britain that they were ready to take on the challenge of conquering the Lake District. With the toughest landscape they had encountered in the nation, peopled by a rebellious tribe, it was no small task, but within a few years, the whole of Lakeland was under their control. Tony Robinson tackles the journey by himself, walking 50 miles from Penrith to Ambleside and on to the Irish Sea at Ravenglass, discovering that the Romans encountered beauty and danger in equal measure.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.desc: Jamie Theakston investigates one of history's most enduring mysteries as he goes on a world-wide search for the Holy Grail, visiting Glastonbury in Somerset, Wales, Valencia in Spain, and New York City to inspect four goblets that could be the ancient relic.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Behind the scenes of a North Yorkshire-based, family-run historic car auction business, which uncovers some remarkably rare vehicles in the picturesque village of Thornton-le-Dale.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A fuel plant in Poland built to make Nazi Germany self-sufficient by using the latest technology of the time to turn coal into oil.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The battle for North Africa, which involved three years of fighting between Rommel's Afrika Korps and Montgomery's Desert Rats and culminated in the Allied victory at El Alamein. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A vast new island in the seas off Dubai, which has been created to house the world's biggest observation wheel - twice the size of the London Eye.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates face a day of hard labour digging drains on a lonely stretch of moorland. However, Fletcher soon finds a way of turning the situation to his advantage. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch desperately wants to get out of the tedious task of making fishing nets, and hatches a crafty scheme to get himself assigned to the library. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher takes on the role of agony aunt and ends up writing letters home for his fellow inmates - but he soon discovers domestic problems of his own when his daughter brings bad news on visiting day. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Patricia Brake.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1980s Sierra Cosworth draws in a crowd of admiring Ford fans, while a restorer delights buyers with his immaculate 1966 Sunbeam Rapier and Sarah takes a shine to a caravan.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The creation of a set of Second World War sea defences built near the mouth of the River Thames to protect London. Plus, a concrete pyramid build during the Cold War.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: The body of a woman is discovered in woodland and all evidence points to suicide, but Taggart's suspicions are shared by the victim's sister who thinks her brother-in-law is responsible. Detective drama, starring Mark McManus.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice receives news that will change her life for ever, while Evie is introduced to impoverished painter Daniel Page.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The birth of Tilly's baby brings excitement to the workshop, but Beatrice is still concerned about her own future. Evie accuses Daniel of betraying her trust.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor and Nurse Carr carry out tuberculosis tests in the East End slums, while Robert's electro-therapy treatment causes problems. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Bramwell
programme.desc: Eleanor is flattered by the attentions of charming Dr Hunter _ but when his housekeeper dies suddenly, she changes her opinion. Period drama, starring Jemma Redgrave.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The officers find themselves stuck in Kenya's Makindi province, struggling to find a safe pick up point. Meanwhile, Dave and Donna are unsure about their future together.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Kerry Young's funeral casts a sombre shadow over Sun Hill as the team gather to pay their last respects to their colleague, but any hopes of a dignified send-off are dashed by an emotional outburst from Gabriel. Debt-ridden Jim fears an investigation into illegal goings-on at the greyhound track will expose his own complicity, while the close professional relationship between Jack and Debbie turns personal.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Rosie is upset to discover that Mubbs has been discussing his feelings about the baby with Connie, but that's nothing to the humiliation of finding out they slept together. Lisa passes her trial as clinical matron and breaks the news of Owen and Diane's engagement to a philosophical Chrissie. An exhausted Tricia struggles to cope on her first day back at work after undergoing chemotherapy and ends up going home early.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A stroke victim brought in for respite care suffers another attack and falls downstairs. At the staff Christmas party, Jude stuns Matt by revealing she is pregnant, while Kate's brave facade begins to crumble. Hospital drama, starring Lisa Coleman and Jason Merrells.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Debbie is assigned a major drugs investigation - much to Phil's irritation and Jim's alarm - but the chance to prove herself takes second place to family concerns when she learns her son has sustained internal bleeding from his fall. The bad news prompts her to hand in her resignation, leaving Jack wondering what the future holds for their relationship. Andrea tells Smithy that Gabriel raped Kerry, whose death continues to take its toll on the renegade copper.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Arthur is full of the joys of Spring and tries to make Pat see the brighter side of life. Grant has an idea to help improve takings and Sharon gets a visit from a brewery rep.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: As Easter approaches, Dot wants to share her news, Gill's plans unsettle Mark, and Pete believes he has the answer to Arthur's problems.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Drama series following the lives of the heroic Blue Watch at Blackwall fire station..

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: Charlie Gimbert plots revenge, while Lovejoy and Lady Jane bicker over a royal dinner service belonging to a Belgian countess. Light-hearted drama, starring Ian McShane and Phyllis Logan.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: Jim wonders why he's been assigned to protect a distinguished journalist, unaware a gang of African thugs are waiting in the wings to cause mayhem. John Nettles and Barry Foster star.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Billy wastes money on a stolen statue and Joey tries to claim an incontinence allowance for Grandad. First episode of Carla Lane's comedy, with Jean Boht and Peter Howitt.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.sub-title: The Erotic Dreams of Mrs Slocombe
programme.desc: In the unlikeliest love match of all time, Mrs Slocombe woos confirmed bachelor Mr Humphries in a bid to make all her romantic dreams come true. Mollie Sugden and John Inman star.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean is bridesmaid at the wedding of Lionel's father, but nobody is sure who is giving the bride away. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg climbs a tree to prove a point, but finds getting down is not as easy. Meanwhile, the police investigate the case of a runaway cooker. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis.

programme.title: Inspector George Gently
programme.desc: A young woman's body is washed up beside a pier, leading Gently and Bacchus to question the staff and guests of the nearby holiday camp where she worked. It turns out she was a popular member of staff, a charismatic performer and great with the guests - but her mother's reaction to her death makes the detectives suspect there is more to her family situation than meets the eye. And when her colleagues' alibis for the night of the murder don't quite stack up, a different picture of the victim - and the camp - comes to light. Martin Shaw and Lee Ingleby star, with guest appearances from Pixie Lott, Lee Boardman, Lisa Riley and Andrea Lowe.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: Danny and Steve 'welcome' new boss Ted Case into the UCOS office in Sasha's absence, but for all his experience, keen eye for detail and a killer instinct for detecting liars, they aren't as sold on his superstitious quirks. While trying to work one another out, the team treads carefully in the case of a murdered vicar who received racist hate mail in the lead up to his death. With emotions running high, it's up to Ted to pull together his new unit and keep the peace in one of UCOS's most sensitive cases. Starring Larry Lamb, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: A social worker is murdered and a key suspect goes missing in this feature-length instalment. The chance discovery of a cache of explosives plunges Jim headlong into a multiple murder investigation and as the death toll mounts, he finds his hardest job is establishing a motive - there may be an Irish connection, or a sinister criminal mastermind could possibly be responsible. Mark McManus stars as the Caledonian copper, with James Macpherson, Iain Anders and Robert Robertson.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Six-part drama based on the true story of the mass murder of a family in an Essex farmhouse in August 1985, providing a fresh insight into these tragic events. In the early hours of August 7th 1985, Nevill and June Bamber were shot and killed inside their farmhouse, along with their adoptive daughter, Sheila Caffell, and Sheila's six-year-old twin sons, Daniel and Nicholas Caffell. Police receive a call from the only surviving member of June and Nevill's immediate family, their adoptive son Jeremy. At first, it appears to be an open-and-shut case to investigating officer DCI Thomas 'Taff' Jones, but for DS Stan Jones, something does not feel right.

programme.title: Masterpiece with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan and co-presenter Rachel Houston-Holland invite more teams of enthusiasts to compete to identify the rarest and most valuable items in stately homes around the country, continuing at Hever Castle in Kent.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Another helping of topical studio discussion from a female perspective, featuring celebrity interviews.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Bridlington, Yorkshire, where Alys Dobbie is dazzled by some emeralds, and Tim Hogarth is unsure if he has stumbled upon a masterpiece.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Warwick Davis hosts the quiz, in which a team of five answer questions about top 10 lists then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Will they have what it takes to head home with the 125,000 cash?.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as contestants Mark, Gill, Peter and Louisa pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aaron is full of remorse, Jamie blindsides Kim and Andrea, and Jai is on the edge.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: When Brian expresses his concerns for Yasmeen to Geoff, he's quietly seething and makes out that Yasmeen is an alcoholic. David is relieved when the consultant confirms that Shona is slowly emerging from her coma, and Nina warms to Roy when he chats about Hayley.

programme.title: Bradley Walsh & Son: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: For the next leg of their journey, the actor and his son head to the Great Smoky Mountains on the Tennessee-North Carolina border, where they go canoeing on the iconic rapids that featured in the film Deliverance. With Bradley left in need of a whisky, they head to a Hillbilly Jam for a nightcap and to experience the mountain tradition of clog dancing, before the pair try their hand at chopping wood with some competitive lumberjacks and taking to the woods to search for a mythical mountain beast.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Yasmeen listens in disbelief as Peter talks about alcoholism and invites her to join him at one of his meetings. Fiz apologises to David for unwittingly bringing a loaded gun onto the street. Bernie confides in Sean how she's been posing as a 14-year-old boy online to get justice for Paul.

programme.title: White House Farm
programme.desc: Stan and his number two Mick Clark speak to Jeremy and relatives of the murdered family, but their picture of what really happened at White House Farm remains inconclusive. The twins' father Colin Caffell is devastated by his loss, and is initially comforted by Jeremy, while post-mortem examinations reveal nothing to contradict the murder-suicide theory. Meanwhile, relative Ann Eaton cannot believe Sheila was responsible, and discusses her growing suspicions with her brother David Boutflour.

programme.title: Scotland Tonight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's headlines from a Scottish perspective, plus local news from Aberdeen, Edinburgh and Glasgow.

programme.title: Peston
programme.desc: Political magazine show presented by Robert Peston, featuring major interviews with MPs, topical guests and cultural figures. Including updates from social media taking in perspectives from viewers, experts and key players throughout the programme.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how one of the fastest bikes in the world was created, how pilots train to perform death-defying acrobatics, and how oil and gas is brought up from the bottom of the sea.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an old Range Rover Mk3 for a bargain price, hoping Edd China can renovate it and have it resprayed white in order to pass it on for double the amount he paid.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini follows up leads on a Woody, a Lotus Elite and a Roadster.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini tries to make some money from a 1967 Dodge Power Wagon, and a two-cylinder Renault is auctioned.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Drivers
programme.desc: More than 50 million people are injured every year on the roads, sparking a boom in dashboard cameras that has captured a wealth of fascinating and surprising footage.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Ron Pitts presents footage of diners being hit by a tornado and bus crashes.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A motorcycle without brakes crashes into a crowd, and nine gallons of chemicals suddenly burst into flames. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: American Loggers
programme.desc: Peak logging season brings anticipation of the deep freeze, and brutal cold soon causes both equipment and emotional breakdowns.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team swipes Chip Foose's truck from under his nose and gives the vehicle the ultimate makeover.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How Russian dolls are made, and the production of aloe vera and flags.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: French polisher Alex restores a 1930s rocking horse. Sculptor Nick rescues a mid-century piece and upholsterer Craig attempts to restore a classic Victorian chair.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: January sees the fishermen returning to their boats and resupplying for the crab-fishing season.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Shawn Pomrenke is hurt in a bar brawl and the future of the Christine Rose is put at risk, while the Wild Ranger crew struggles with a leak and an injury to one of the team.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Jared and Johnny's epic mission grinds to a halt, Roscoe battles the elements on a world famous rally, and Turbo is flagged down by the police.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer spots a well-maintained Mercedes 560SL, which was the car of choice for rich petrol-heads in 1987, and sets out to give the vehicle a complete refresh.

programme.title: Supertruckers
programme.desc: Sgt Major and Sully battle the elements loading two 16-tonne Royal Marines landing craft in Instow, Devon. Plus, the firm add a brand-new truck to their growing fleet.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson heads to Lake Michigan to investigate an unexplained Bermuda Triangle-like phenomenon that has caused ships to disappear for centuries.

programme.title: Railroad Australia
programme.desc: Sugar cane driver Ray races to get to the mill before his cargo deteriorates. Plus, drivers Mick and Simon battle to descend the mighty Blue Mountain range in a huge freight train.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fleet pushes on despite heavy Arctic storms. The Time Bandit continues with a limited amount of bait, while the Maverick and Rollo dump their pots to stay upright. Meanwhile, tension mounts after the Cornelia Marie stays in Dutch Harbour for three days, with the captain's son eager to take to the seas to earn more money.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: Emily Riedel has an experience that teaches her the dangers of dredging, while novice crews and poorly designed vessels cause tempers to flare.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to an antiques shop in Edinburgh on a hunt for new stock, and on an expedition to a 750-year-old house, he discovers an item that takes him out of his comfort zone.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Carl Andrews gets behind the wheel to transport a sizeable load, Russell's mobile classroom is shaken and the Ferrises manage to dodge raging bush fires.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer buys an old Range Rover Mk3 for a bargain price, hoping Edd China can renovate it and have it resprayed white in order to pass it on for double the amount he paid.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Master blacksmith Neville Morris works on a piece of railing that was once a Victorian club fender. Meanwhile, Martin restores a Second World War RAF hero's bomber jacket.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Seeing an untapped source of rare items, Drew Pritchard tours Catalonia looking for some chic Spanish antiques. In Peralada, he is blown away by a 17th-century house full of treasures.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: On a trip to Barcelona to buy antiques Drew Pritchard uncovers an early, two-door Range Rover. In Hampshire, he and Paul Cowland disagree on how to restore a Porsche 944.

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien travel across the UK to find unique and valuable items, and their latest find is an old bureau which gets a makeover in Yorkshire.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how New York bagels are hand-rolled, how they make a racing car tyre that will grip the track at 320kph, and how life-like sculptures are created out of glass.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: A look at how waste is collected in Venice, how Australia's famous sheepskin boots are made, and how pond algae is turned into a health supplement.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: The case of prisoner Mario, held for abduction and rape. When he managed to escape, he took hostages, killed a policeman, and led FBI officers on a wild chase.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three cases in which investigators employed forensic science in tracking, apprehending and convicting serial killers.

programme.title: Copycat Killers
programme.desc: The case of teenager Jake Evan, who after watching slasher film Halloween was inspired to recreate one brutal scene. However, he soon learned that real life doesn't unfold like the movies.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of retired teacher Margaret Jack Sliger, shot dead in her farmyard in Mooresburg in May 2015. Kyle Robert Wolfe, a 15-year-old boy, later pleaded guilty to the crime.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Bureau's hunt for a gang of serial killers who targeted police in Washington DC, claiming several victims before months of painstaking nationwide surveillance finally paid off.

programme.title: Animal Cops San Francisco
programme.desc: Officer Forester races to save the life of a critically ill cat, Lieutenant Scott tracks down a dog that ran away following an explosion and the team tries to rescue 77 collies.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats a tiger with toothache and checks on some puppies that will be trained into guide dogs. Meanwhile, Lisa battles to save a much-loved Pomeranian.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown delivers a litter of 10 assistance-dog puppies and helps a kitten in a critical condition after a freak accident. Plus, a snake is seriously injured.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The wedding guru herself, Martha Stewart, visits Kleinfeld, hoping to help bride Bailey choose her perfect dress.
